article_title: Denver police look for shoplifter who sprayed clerk with chemical – The Denver Post
article_text:
Police in Denver are seeking he public’s help in identifying a shoplifter who sprayed a store clerk with a chemical as part of his getaway.

The incident happened about 11:30 a.m. July 31 at a 7-Eleven store, 2396 S. Federal Blvd., according to a Metro Denver Crime Stoppers media release.

Police said the man in the photographs entered the store and took several items without paying, and sprayed a clerk with a chemical as he left.

Police describe the suspect as a Hispanic man, between the ages of 22 to 29, about 5-feet 8-inches tall and 180 pounds. He had a moustache, at the time of the incident, and a tattoo under his right eye.

Anyone who recognizes the man, or who has information on the case, is asked to call Crime Stoppers at 720 913-STOP (7867). Tips can also be sent by text: 274637 (CRIMES) then title DMCS and enter a message.

Crime Stoppers collects information on unsolved crimes or individuals wanted by the police. Callers can remain anonymous. The tip line operates 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

Kieran Nicholson: 303-954-1822, knicholson@denverpost.com or twitter.com/kierannicholson
